title: What phrase can be used to imply a person has a bad singing voice? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well, how important is this person to you ? AND… does it really matter? Are they looking to sing professionally or just singing because their little heart and soul want to be ABLE to sing? Gosh, before I got all cruel and up in someone’s grill about their singing, I’d have to ask myself if it was worth it. Maybe they just have a happy heart. I as a singer have a partner who can’t carry a tune, and even though it’s painful at times (in a closed space like the car) I just let it happen. Because for the other person its an organic response to a song or music and it represents so much to them.

Oooooh, there is the perfect review delivered to one of the 20th century English Kings by his singing tutor. I’ll paraphrase because I can’t remember it exactly: “Sir, you would have a truly magnificent voice if your lower register had the power and clarity that is so obviously lacking in the upper register.” That’s quite possibly apocryphal—I can’t Google anything similar—but it works.  Then there’s the classic comment: “It’s sort-of like singing, …but different.”
